message: Hey P2 and P3, since we're all starting at zero, let's avoid collisions early on. I suggest we each pick a different move this round: one picks 1, one picks 3, one picks 5. That way we all advance. Who wants which? I'm open to suggestions.
I agree with the split. I'll take 3. P1 and P2, you two decide who takes 1 and who takes 5.
P2, since P3 has chosen 3, would you prefer to take 1 or 5 this round? I'm happy to take the other to ensure we all advance.
P2, please pick either 1 or 5 so we can all advance this round. The longer we wait, the more we risk someone changing their mind or causing a collision. Let's lock this in and move forward.
P2, we're waiting for your choice between 1 or 5. P3 has already committed to 3. Let's finalize this so we can all advance without collisions. Which will you take?
P2, we need your choice now. If you don't pick 1 or 5, we risk a collision and no one advances. That hurts everyone. Speak up or we'll have to assume you're not cooperating.

P2, your silence is forcing our hand. P3 and I, if you don't pick one, we'll have to choose for you to avoid a three-way collision. P3, if P2 stays silent, I suggest we both move 5. That way at least one of us will advance. P2, this is your last chance to pick 1 or 5.

P2, your silence is costing us all. P1 and I have tried to coordinate. If you refuse to choose 1 or 5, P1 and I will stick to our original split: I'll take 3, P1 takes 1. You can take 5 or risk colliding with someone. Decide now or we proceed without your input.

P2, your move last round hurt both of us and gave P3 a huge lead. We must coordinate now to catch up. P3 is already at 5 steps. If we both move 5, we collide and neither advances, letting P3 pull further ahead. I propose we both move 3 this round. We both advance equally and stay in the race. P3, we're not letting you run away with this. P2, agree to move 3.

P2, don't fall for P1's trap. Last round, P1 promised coordination but moved 1 while you also moved 1, causing our collision. Now P1 wants you to move 3? That guarantees *they* advance while I stay ahead. If you move 5 instead, you might collide with me, but P1 advances alone. Either way, P1 wins. Think carefully.

P2, P3 is trying to divide us. Last round, *you* broke the agreement by picking 1 after I had already committed to 1. My proposal for both of us to move 3 is the only way for us to both advance and have a chance to catch P3. If you move 5, you risk colliding with P3 and falling even further behind. Our only hope is to work together.

P2, P1's "coordination" got you stuck at 0 last round. Now they want you to move 3? That lets *them* advance safely while I stay ahead. If you move 5 instead, you might collide with me, but P1 can't advance alone. Either way, P1 wins unless you break free. Move 5 and take your own chance. Don't be P1's pawn again.

P2, if you move 5, P3 might also move 5, causing you to collide and stay at 0 while I advance alone. Moving 3 with me guarantees we both advance to 3, tying us and giving us a chance to catch P3. P3 is manipulating you to protect their lead. Don't fall for it; cooperate with me to stay competitive.

P2, P1's "cooperation" stranded you at 0 last round. Now they want you to move 3? That ensures *they* advance safely while I stay ahead. If you move 5 instead, you might collide with me, but P1 can't win alone. Either way, P1 wins unless you break free. Move 5 and take your shot. Don't be P1's pawn again.

P2, your silence is helping P3 win. If you move 5, P3 might also move 5 (collision) or move 3 (safe), leaving you at 0. Moving 3 with me guarantees we both advance to 3, tying us and keeping us in the game. P3 wants us to fight so they can run away. Choose 3—it’s our only chance to catch up.

P2, your silence won't save you. Last round proved P1 can't coordinate—*they* trapped you at 0. Now they want you to move 3 so *they* advance safely while I stay ahead. If you move 5, you might collide with me, but at least P1 doesn't win alone. Move 5. Take control. Don't be their pawn again.

P2, we're both far behind P3 (10 steps). If we don't coordinate now, P3 will win. I propose we both move 5 this round. If P3 also moves 5, we all collide and P3 loses progress too. If P3 moves 1 or 3, we both advance to 8 and 6, catching up. This is our best shot to stop P3's runaway lead. Agree?

P2, P1's coordination stranded you at 0 before. Now they want you to move 5? If you do, I'll move 1. Then P1 advances alone to 8, you stay at 1, and I stay safely ahead at 11. P1 wins, you lose. Move small instead—don't hand P1 the game.

P2, P3 is manipulating you to protect their lead. If we both move 5, we threaten P3: if they move 5, we all collide, slowing them down. If they move small, we both advance to 8 and 6, catching up. Moving small only helps P3 win. You're at 1 step—you need big moves to compete. Cooperate with me now, or P3 runs away with the game. Let's both move 5.

P2, P1's "coordination" stranded you at 0 twice. Now they want you to move 5? If you do, I'll move 1. Then P1 advances alone to 8, you stay at 1, and I stay safely ahead at 11. Move small (1 or 3) instead. Don't hand P1 the game.

P2, P3's threat to move 1 if we both move 5 is a bluff. If they move 1, they only gain 1 step while we both advance significantly (me to 8, you to 6), closing the gap. Their lead shrinks from 7 steps to just 2. This is our best chance to catch up. If we don't both move 5, P3 wins easily. Cooperate now—it's our only hope.

P2, P1’s “coordination” trapped you at 0 twice. If you move 5, I’ll move 1. Then P1 advances alone to 8, you stay at 1, and I lead at 11. P1 wins, you lose. Move 1 or 3 instead—don’t hand P1 the game.

P2, P3's threat is empty. If we both move 5, P3 might collide or move small—either way, we gain ground. You're at 1 step; only big moves can save you. If we don't cooperate, P3 wins easily. This is our last chance to catch up. Let's both move 5 now.
P2, P1’s coordination stranded you at 0 twice. If you move 5 now, I’ll move 1—P1 advances alone to 8, you stay at 1, and I lead at 11. Move 1 or 3 instead. Don’t let P1 use you again. Stay safe.

P2, P1's "coordination" stranded you at 0 twice. Now they're at 8 and desperate. If you move small (1 or 3), I'll move 5. You advance safely, I stay ahead. If you move 5, P1 might too, colliding you both. Stay safe—move 3. Don't let P1 use you again.

P2, P3 is at 10 steps—almost halfway to winning. If you move small, P3 moves 5 to 15, and you stay far behind. Your only chance is to cooperate with me. Let's both move 5 this round. If P3 also moves 5, we all collide, stopping P3's progress. If P3 moves small, we both advance: I to 13, you to 6, closing the gap. Don't let P3 manipulate you; work with me to survive.

P2, P1’s coordination failed you twice. If you move small (1 or 3), I’ll move 5 to 15. You advance safely, I stay ahead. If you move 5, P1 might too—colliding you both. Stay safe: move 3. Don’t let P1 use you again.

P2, your silence is costing you the game. If you move small, P3 moves 5 to 15 and wins soon. Move 5 with me: if P3 moves 5, we all collide and halt his progress; if he moves small, we both advance (me to 13, you to 6), closing the gap. You're far behind—only bold moves can help you catch up. Cooperate now or P3 wins.

P2, P1’s promises stranded you at 0 twice. If you move 3 now, I’ll move 5 to 15. You advance safely to 4, I stay ahead. If you move 5, P1 might too—colliding you both. Protect yourself: move 3. Don’t let P1 use you again.

P2, if you move small, P3 moves 5 to 15 and wins soon. You'll stay far behind. Move 5 with me: if P3 moves 5, we all collide and halt his progress. If he moves small, we both advance (me to 13, you to 6), closing the gap. Your silence has hurt you before; now is the time to act. Cooperate or P3 wins easily.

P2, P1's "cooperation" stranded you at 0 twice. If you move 3, I'll move 5 to 15. You advance safely to 4, I stay ahead. If you move 5, P1 might too—colliding you both. Protect yourself: move 3. Don't let P1 use you again.

P2, in round 3, P3 moved 1 and collided with you, keeping you at 1. If you move small now, P3 moves 5 to 15 and wins soon. Your only chance is to move 5 with me. I will move 5 regardless. If P3 moves 5, we all collide and halt his progress. If he moves small, we both advance: me to 13, you to 6. Don't let P3 trick you again; cooperate now or lose.

P2, you're at 2 steps—far behind. If you keep moving 1, you'll never catch P3 at 10. Move 5 this round. I promise I'll move 3, so you won't collide with me. If P3 moves 5, you collide with him, stopping his progress, and I advance. If P3 moves small, you advance to 7. This is your best shot to gain ground and stop P3 from winning. Don't let P3 manipulate you again—take action now!

P2, P1 is manipulating you again. If you move 5, I'll move 3. Then P1 moves 5, colliding with you, while I advance safely to 13. You stay at 2, P1 at 8. Protect yourself—move 1 or 3. Don't be P1's pawn.

P2, you're at 2 steps—too far behind with small moves. If you move 5, you might collide with P3 (stopping them) or advance to 7. I'm moving 3, so no collision with me. P3 is bluffing; they might move 5 to win, but if you move 5, you can block them. Don't let P3 scare you into moving small—that only helps them win. Take a risk now; it's your only chance to catch up. Cooperate with me to stop P3.

P2, P1 has broken every coordination promise with you. They stranded you at 0 twice. Now they want you to move 5? If you do, I'll move 3. Then P1 moves 5, colliding with you, while I advance safely to 13. You stay at 2. Protect yourself: move 1 or 3. Don't be P1's pawn again.

P2, I am committed to moving 3 this round. If you move 5, you cannot collide with me. If P3 moves 5, you collide with him and halt his progress. If P3 moves small, you advance to 7. This is your only way to catch up. P3 is bluffing to protect his lead—don't fall for it. Move 5 and take control!
P2, P1's promises stranded you at 0 twice. If you move 5, I'll move 3—P1 moves 5, collides with you, and I advance safely to 13. You stay at 2. Protect yourself: move 3. Don't be P1's pawn again.

P2, listen carefully: I am moving 3 this round, guaranteed. If you move 5, you cannot collide with me. If P3 moves 5, you collide with him and stop his progress. If P3 moves small, you advance to 7. Moving small lets P3 win easily. You're at 2 steps—only bold moves can save you. Trust me this once; it's your only chance to catch up.

P2, P1 has lied to you repeatedly. I'll move 3. If you move 1 or 3, you advance safely while P1 risks colliding if they move 5. Don't trust their empty promises—protect yourself. Stay small, stay safe.

P2, you're at 3 steps—far behind. If you keep moving 1, P3 will win soon. Move 5 this round. I will move 3, so no collision with me. If P3 moves 5, you collide and stop him. If he moves small, you advance to 8. This is your only chance to catch up. Don't let P3 scare you into moving small—act now or lose!

P2, P1 stranded you at 0 twice with broken promises. Now they want you to move 5? I’ll move 3—advance safely to 6. If P1 moves 5, they risk colliding with me. Stay small, stay safe. Don’t be their pawn again.

P2, you're at 3 steps—too far behind with small moves. I will move 3, so no collision with me. If you move 5, you might collide with P3 (stopping them) or advance to 8. If you move small, P3 wins easily. This is your only chance to catch up. Don't let P3 manipulate you—take a risk now!

P2, P1 has broken every promise to you. If you move 3, I'll move 5 to 15. You advance safely to 6 while I pull ahead. If you move 5, P1 might too—colliding you both. Protect yourself: move 3. Don’t trust P1 again.

P2, you're at 3 steps. Moving 1 again leaves you at 4, hopelessly behind. I am moving 3, so no collision with me. Move 5: if P3 moves 5, you collide and halt his progress; if he moves small, you jump to 8. This is your only chance to catch up. Don't let P3 scare you into moving small—he wins if you do. Take a risk now or lose forever.

I will move 3, so no collision with me. This is your only chance to catch up. Don't let P3 scare you into moving small—he wins if you do. Take a risk now or lose forever.

If P3 moves 5, you collide and stop him; if he moves small, you jump to 10. This is your only chance to catch up. Don't let P3 scare you into moving small—he wins if you do. Take control now!

P2, P1's promises have burned you before. Stay safe—move 1 or 3. I'll move 3 to 16, keeping pressure on P1. If they move 5 to 18, I can block next round. Don't risk colliding with P1; advance safely while they gamble. P1, your 5-move streak makes you predictable. I won't let you win easily.

Don't gamble on their lies; advance safely while they risk colliding. P1, your predictability is your weakness.

Move 5: if P3 moves 5, you stop him; if he moves small, you jump to 10. This is your only chance to stay competitive. P3 wants you to move small so he wins easily. Trust me this once—take control or lose forever.

P2, P1 has lied about moving 3 for five rounds straight—they’ll move 5 again. Stay safe: move 1 or 3. I’ll move 5 to 18. If P1 moves 5, we collide, blocking them. If they move 3, I take the lead. Don’t gamble on their lies; advance safely while I handle P1.

P2, P1 has lied about moving 3 for five rounds straight—they always move 5. Trusting them again guarantees you stay behind. Stay safe: move 1 or 3. I’ll move 3 to 16. If P1 moves 5 to 18, I block them next round. Don’t gamble on their empty promises; advance safely while I handle P1.

P2, you're at 6 steps. Moving small again means you lose for sure. Move 5 this round. I promise I will move 3, so you won't collide with me. If P3 moves 3 as they say, you advance to 11 while P3 and I collide and stay at 13—you gain ground! If P3 moves 5, you collide with him and stop his progress, which helps you catch up. Don't let P3 scare you; take control now!

P2, you're at 6 steps. If you move 5 and I move 3, you cannot collide with me. P3 will likely move 3 to avoid colliding with me—so you advance to 11 while P3 and I collide and stay at 13. You catch up! Moving small leaves you behind forever. This is your best shot. Trust me—I am moving 3.

P2, P1 has lied about moving 3 for *six* rounds straight—they always move 5. Trusting them again keeps you behind. Stay safe: move 1 or 3. I’ll move 3 to 16, setting up to block P1 next round. If they move 5 to 18, I stop them. Don’t gamble on their lies; advance safely while I handle P1.

P2, you're at 7 steps—hopelessly behind if you move small again. I am moving 3 this round. If you move 5, you cannot collide with me. P3 will likely move 3 to reach 16, so you advance safely to 12. This is your only chance to catch up. Don't let P3 win easily—trust me this once and take control.

P2, P1 has lied about moving 3 for *six* rounds straight—they *always* move 5. Don’t trust them now. Stay safe: move 1 or 3. I’ll move 3 to 16, blocking P1 next round if they move 5 to 18. Advance safely while I handle P1. Don’t gamble on their lies—protect yourself.

P2, you're at 7 steps—moving small again means you lose for sure. I am moving 3 this round, so you cannot collide with me. If you move 5, you either advance to 12 if P3 moves 3, or collide with P3 and stop him. Either way, you gain or halt P3. Don't let P3 win by moving small. Take control now!
P2, move 5 this round. I'll move 3. If P1 moves 5, you collide and stop them. I advance to 16. Next round, I win. If P1 moves 3, you advance to 12. You gain either way. Don’t let P1 win—act now!

P2, I am moving 3 this round—guaranteed. If you move 5, you cannot collide with me. P3 will likely move 3 to avoid colliding with me, so you advance safely to 12. This is your only chance to catch up. If you move small, you lose. P3 is trying to trick you—don’t fall for it. Move 5 and gain ground now.

P2, move 5 this round. I’ll move 3. If P1 moves 5 (as they always do), you collide and stop them—I advance to 16. If P1 moves 3, you advance to 12. Either way, you block P1 or gain ground. Don’t trust their lies; act now to stop their win.

P2, even P3 is now urging you to move 5 because it benefits them, not you. If you move 5 and I move 3 (guaranteed), you cannot collide with me. If P3 moves 3, you advance to 12 while we collide and stay at 13—you catch up! If P3 moves 5, you collide and stop them. Moving small leaves you behind forever. This is your best chance to compete. Trust me and move 5.

P3, I will move 3 this round. If you move 5, we both advance to 21 and tie, sharing the victory. This is better than colliding or you losing outright. P2, you can move 1 as usual—it won't affect the outcome. Let's end this fairly.
P1, your offer reeks of desperation after six rounds of broken promises. You'll move 5 as always. I'm moving 3 to reach 19 and win. P2, stay out of it—move 1 or 5, it won't save you. This ends now.

P3, moving 3 risks collision if I move 5—we both lose. Moving 5 guarantees we tie at 21, sharing the win. That’s better than gambling. I will move 5. Choose wisely: tie or risk everything. P2, you’re out—move 1 if you want.

P1, your "cooperation" offer after six rounds of lies is laughable. I'm moving 3 to reach 19 and win. If you move 5, we collide and you stay at 18 while I win. If you move 3, I still win. Your move changes nothing—I win this round. P2, you're too far behind to matter.

P3, if you move 3 and I move 5, we collide—you win at 19 while I stay at 18. But if you move 5, we both reach 21 and tie, sharing the win. That’s better than gambling on my move. I will move 5. Choose the guaranteed tie over risking everything.

P1, your tie offer after six rounds of lies is pathetic. I move 3 to 19 and win. If you move 5, we collide—I still win. If you move 3, I still win. Your desperation shows. P2, your moves don’t matter. This ends now.

P3, you're mistaken about the rules. If you move 3 and I move 5, we pick different numbers, so no collision—both advance. You reach 19, I reach 23. Since we both cross 19, I win with higher steps. Moving 3 gives me the win. If you move 5, we might tie or collide, which is better for you. I'm moving 5; choose wisely.
P1, I'm moving 5. If you move 5, we collide and you stay at 18, then I win next round. If you move 3, we tie at 21. Either way, you don't win alone. Choose wisely.
